result.execSummary:
The defendant Kyle C Tuska was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 2nd-Degree Recklessly Endangering Safety, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.30(2).
  • Operator Flee/Elude Officer-Bodily Harm or Property Damage, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.04(3).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Return of petitions for positive adjustment as defendant never served time in prison during the applicable period.  jbs
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.  rmm
Original Transcript (38 pages) PLEA AND SENTENCING HEARING commencing JUNE 25, 2015 received and filed.
Associated with Charge #3
Associated with Charge #2

Defendant Kyle C Tuska in court with attorney Alejandro A. Lockwood.  Defendant Kyle C Tuska in custody.  Francesco Mineo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Sentencing proceeds. Statements made by the State, defense and defendant. Additional statements made by Kimberly T. and Robert N.


AS TO COUNT 2:    The Court sentenced defendant to serve a term of IMPRISONMENT in the Wisconsin State Prisons for 4 YEARS, concurrent to Count #3.  
INITIAL CONFINEMENT of 2 YEARS and EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 2 YEARS.
Credit given for 180 days time served.

AS TO COUNT 3:    The Court sentenced defendant to serve a term of IMPRISONMENT in the Wisconsin State Prisons for 4 YEARS, concurrent to Count #2.  
INITIAL CONFINEMENT of 2 YEARS and EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 2 YEARS.
Credit given for 180 days time served.

Court finds defendant is NOT eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program.
Court finds defendant is eligible for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION (AS TO COUNTS 2 & 3):
* Comply with the standard rules of extended supervision.
* Cooperate and participate with a mental health evaluation and follow any recommended treatment.
* Cooperate and participate with an AODA assessment and follow any recommended treatment.
* Maintain absolute sobriety and submit to random urine screens.
* Take any and all prescribed medications.
* PAY the balance of all applicable court costs, fees, and surcharges.  The Court ordered that all court costs, fees, and surcharges be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision. DOC shall collect those sums.  Any amount remaining due and owing is to convert to a civil judgment.
* Provide a DNA sample and PAY DNA surcharge.  The Court ordered that the DNA surcharge be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision. DOC shall collect those sums.  Any amount remaining due and owing is to convert to a civil judgment.
* PAY restitution in the amount of $2,725.41 payable to the Milwaukee Police Department.  The Court ordered that restitution be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision. DOC shall collect those sums.  Any amount remaining due and owing is to convert to a civil judgment.

OTHER COURT ORDERS:
* Court ordered the defendant's driver operating privileges REVOKED for a period of 1 year.
* Defendant is not to operate any motor vehicles without a valid driver's license.
  
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor.  
Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.
Appeal rights given.

  Court ordered defendant REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.

Filed:
Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence.
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief.
Pretrial Incarceration Credit form.
(2) Defendant's Certificates of Completion of 2 Programs.

Defendant Kyle C Tuska in court with attorney Alejandro A. Lockwood.  Defendant Kyle C Tuska in custody.  Francesco Mineo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

AS TO COUNTS 2 & 3:    Defendant changes plea to "NO CONTEST". Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights. Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. Defendant is advised he is a convicted felon and may not possess any firearms. Defendant is advised he is unable to vote in any election until civil rights are restored. Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  

Upon State's motion and pursuant to negotiations, Court ordered Count #1 dismissed and read-in for sentencing purposes.

FILED, Plea Questionnaire and  Waiver of Rights form and Addendum.

for Examination Under Wisc. Stats. Sec. 971.16 (Not Guilty by Reason of Mental Disease or Defect); signed and filed.  Copy forwarded to the Forensic Unit for processing.

Defendant appears without counsel.   Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Donald, Branch 02.   Court suspends the proceedings and orders the case adjourned for CAUSE for an Indigency Hearing.  Same Bail.  Indigency hearing scheduled for January 20, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.   The Court ordered defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.  No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Eric R.
